conclusion: Analyze the circuit in both open and closed switch scenarios.
When the switch is open, only R1 is in the circuit.
The current I0 = 0.5 A flows through R1.
Calculate voltage U using Ohm's Law: U = I0 x R1 = 10 V.
When the switch is closed, both R1 and motor M (with internal resistance R2) are in the circuit.
Total resistance in the circuit is R1 + R2 = 30 Ω.
Calculate current I using Ohm's Law: I = U / (R1 + R2) = 1/3 A.
Calculate power P: P = U x I = 10/3 W ≈ 3.33 W.
Compare calculated power P with 15 W: P ≈ 3.33 W is less than 15 W.
